Package board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Board class creates a board for the chess game to be played on and takes care of game logic from basic piece movement to castling, enpassant, and promotion.

    The Board class implements the Serializable interface which is used for making deep copies of the board.

    Author:
    Jahnavi Bavuluri and Chiraag Rekhari
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.String currentPlayer
      Contains the color of the current player -- either white or black.
      Piece kingInCheck
      Contains the King piece that is currently in check, null if there is no King in check.
      java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces
      Contains all of the Pieces on the board that are currently in play.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Creates a Board object that initializes the pieces on the board as well as makes the current player white.

    • Method Detail

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Makes a deep copy of the board - including the individual pieces on the board, their location, and color.

        The Serializable interface is used for this method.

        Returns:
        a deep copy of the current board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws an exception by the serialization class, which is a subclass of IOException

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece​(Piece p)
        Removes the specified piece from the board by removing it from the pieces ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        p - the Piece to be removed from the board

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece​(Piece p)
        Adds the specified piece to the board by adding it to the pieces ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        p - the Piece to be added to the board

      • getPieceAt

        public Piece getPieceAt​(java.awt.Point p)
        Gets the piece from the specified location on the board.
        Parameters:
        p - a Point which specifies a location on the board
        Returns:
        the Piece that is at Point p on the board

      • kingInCheck

        public boolean kingInCheck()
        Used to check if the current players king is in check.

        This method is implemented inside each Piece class when finding the valid moves a piece can make on a given board. If this method returns true, that move is deleted from the valid moves ArrayList as making this move will put the current player's own king in check.

        Returns:
        true if the current players king is in check, false otherwise

      • check

        public Piece check()
        Checks the board if the current players king is in check as a result of the opposing team and returns the King in check, if one exists.
        Returns:
        the King piece in check if one exists

      • letterToNumber

        public int letterToNumber​(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string into the corresponding column number.

        Used for user input. Letter 'a' corresponds to column 0, letter 'b' corresponds to column 1 and so on. Used for consistency between all Piece locations and Points.

        Parameters:
        s - the string to be converted into the corresponding column
        Returns:
        the column number that String s corresponds to

      • move

        public java.awt.Point[] move​(java.lang.String start,
                             java.lang.String end)
        Converts the users' string input into an array of Points that constitutes the move that the player is trying to make.

        The first Point in the Points array is the starting location and the second Point is the ending location.

        Parameters:
        start - the String starting location of the move as input by the user
        end - the String ending location of the move as input by the user
        Returns:
        a Points array of the move where the first Point in the array is the starting location and the second Point is the ending location

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Checks the validity of the move and returns true if the move can be made.

        This method checks 4 criteria: that there exists a Piece on the board at the starting position, that the move is a valid point within the range of the board, that the piece being moved is of the current player's color, and that the move is within the Pieces valid moves.

        Parameters:
        points - the Points array that stores the starting location of the move and the ending location of the move
        Returns:
        true of this move can be made, false otherwise

      • tryMove

        public Board tryMove​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Tries a given move on a copy of the current board to check if the move is a valid move -- i. e. the current players king is not in check.

        This method is used in each Piece class to return a helper board and call the kingInCheck() method on it.

        Parameters:
        points - the move that is being performed
        Returns:
        a copy of the current board with the move performed

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Makes a given move on a board.

        The move can be made either on a deep copy of the board or on the actual board itself. The move also handles captures.

        Parameters:
        points - the move that is being made on the board

      • firstMove

        public void firstMove​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Changes the castling boolean value of a Rook or King the first time it is moved.

        Used for the castling implementation. If a Rook or King has moved, it can no longer castle.

        Parameters:
        points - the move that is being performed on the board

      • doCastle

        public void doCastle​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Checks if the move being performed is castling and moves the rook to the specified location as according to castling rules.
        Parameters:
        points - the move that is being made on the board -- must be a castling move for this method to change the current board

      • checkPromotion

        public boolean checkPromotion​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Checks if the move being performed is a pawn promotion.
        Parameters:
        points - the move being made on the board
        Returns:
        true if this move is a pawn promotion, false otherwise

      • promotion

        public void promotion​(Piece promotionPiece,
                      java.awt.Point[] points)
        Actually performs the pawn promotion by adding a new Piece to the pieces ArrayList and deleting the old pawn.

        Also changes the current player of the board.

        Parameters:
        promotionPiece - the Piece that the user wants to promote the pawn to -- can either be Q,N,B,R
        points - the move being made on the board

      • checkmate

        public boolean checkmate()
        Checks if the current board has a player in checkmate.
        Returns:
        true if the board is in checkmate, false otherwise

      • enpassant

        public void enpassant​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Changes the enpassant conditions on every turn.

        Sets all enpassant fields to false for the current player to reinitialize the pawns and based on the move changes the enpassant fields of the pawn.

        Parameters:
        points - the move being made on the board

      • doEnpassant

        public void doEnpassant​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Handles the enpassant move if the given move corresponds to an enpassant.
        Parameters:
        points - the move being made on the board

      • checkEnpassant

        public boolean checkEnpassant​(java.awt.Point[] points)
        Checks if a given move corresponds to an enpassant move.
        Parameters:
        points - the move being made on the board
        Returns:
        true if the given move is enpassant, false otherwise

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        Prints out the board with the names of each piece in its corresponding location.

        Also checks for check and checkmate and prints out the appropriate messages should those conditions be satisfied.
